items.title: Starting a Tech Blog
items.description:
Charlin shares why you should start a blog, some ideas for things to write and finding motivation.

Starting my Tech Blog by Charlin Agramonte

Charlin shares why you should start a blog, some ideas for things to write and finding motivation.

items.title: Designing cards
items.description:
Card style views are a stable in Apps. But how do you design a good one?

Designing cards by Mohana Das

[**Designing cards**](https://uxdesign.cc/designing-cards-for-beginners-9ed9454d27f6) by [Mohana Das](https://uxdesign.cc/@mohanadas.dsi)

items.title: The 13 scientific principles every UXer needs to know
items.description:
What are the scientific reasons behind the choices you make? How many studies have been done? Where is the evidence? Isn’t it subjective?… Well, it isn’t!

The 13 scientific principles every UXer needs to know by Hossein Raspberry
items.description_markdown:
What are the scientific reasons behind the choices you make? How many studies have been done? Where is the evidence? Isn’t it subjective?… Well, it isn’t!

[**The 13 scientific principles every UXer needs to know**](https://uxdesign.cc/the-13-scientific-principles-every-uxer-needs-to-know-b7c347d74351) by [Hossein Raspberry](https://uxdesign.cc/@hosseinraspberry)

embedded_links.title: **The 13 scientific principles every UXer needs to know**

items.title: Using SVG Images, VectorDrawable
items.description:
By default, Android does not support svg. For this, they invented VectorDrawable, which can display svgs.

items.description_markdown:

items.title: Xamarin Forms Month and Year Picker
items.description:
Sometimes we want to select a Date with Month, Day and a Year and we can go with global custom picker on Xamarin.Forms or in an easy way create a Native picker to makes the app more predictable and harmonious for users.

Xamarin Forms Month and Year Picker by Bohdan Benetskyi
items.description_markdown:
Sometimes we want to select a Date with Month, Day and a Year and we can go with global custom picker on Xamarin.Forms or in an easy way create a Native picker to makes the app more predictable and harmonious for users.

[**Xamarin Forms Month and Year Picker**](https://medium.com/@benetskyybogdan/xamarin-forms-month-and-year-picker-105550772222) by [Bohdan Benetskyi](https://medium.com/@benetskyybogdan)

items.title: Using and Creating Behaviors
items.description:
Don't you wish you could add functionality to UI controls without having to subclass them and do all kinds of complex stuff? You can with Behaviors! In this video we see what Behaviors are. We will learn how to consume them in your own code, but also how to create them yourself!

Using and Creating #Behaviors for your UI controls in #XamarinForms by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
Don't you wish you could add functionality to UI controls without having to subclass them and do all kinds of complex stuff? You can with Behaviors! In this video we see what Behaviors are. We will learn how to consume them in your own code, but also how to create them yourself!

[**Using and Creating #Behaviors for your UI controls in #XamarinForms**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EKmj8Got_gE) by [Gerald Versluis](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCBBZ2kXWmd8eXlHg2wEaClw)

embedded_links.title: **Using and Creating #Behaviors for your UI controls in #XamarinForms**

items.title: Null Pointers 15: Xamarin Community Toolkit
items.description:
In this episode, we talk about the Xamarin Community Toolkit. You will get a scoop of the origins and how it came about. What the intentions are behind it and how it differs compared to the other well known Xamarin Essentials library. Be sure to tune in and have all the knowledge ready should the Xamarin Community Toolkit become the discussion topic of your next (remote) party.

15: Xamarin Community Toolkit – Null Pointers by Null Pointers
items.description_markdown:
In this episode, we talk about the Xamarin Community Toolkit. You will get a scoop of the origins and how it came about. What the intentions are behind it and how it differs compared to the other well known Xamarin Essentials library. Be sure to tune in and have all the knowledge ready should the Xamarin Community Toolkit become the discussion topic of your next (remote) party.

[**15: Xamarin Community Toolkit – Null Pointers**](https://nullpointers.io/15/) by [Null Pointers](https://nullpointers.io)

items.title: Xamarin Podcast: Drawing, VS2019, & Virtual Meetups
items.description:
Ever looked at your app and thought, “It needs some shapes or gradients to make the final touches”? Now with Xamarin.Forms 4.8, you can customize that design experience for your users. Tune-in to find out how you can draw any shape you want using Xamarin.Forms 4.8. Including adding in the content of an SVG file with the ease.

Xamarin Podcast: Drawing, VS2019, & Virtual Meetups

And you need gradients? Xamarin.Forms has gradients too! This podcast episode has you covered.
items.description_markdown:
Ever looked at your app and thought, “It needs some shapes or gradients to make the final touches”? Now with Xamarin.Forms 4.8, you can customize that design experience for your users. Tune-in to find out how you can draw any shape you want using Xamarin.Forms 4.8. Including adding in the content of an SVG file with the ease.

[**Xamarin Podcast: Drawing, VS2019, & Virtual Meetups**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/drawing-xamarin-podcast/)

And you need gradients? Xamarin.Forms has gradients too! This podcast episode has you covered.
